definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)

sentences.english: Strawberry, blackcurrant, litchi and mango are some popular flavoured yoghurt.
sentences.chinese: 草莓，黑醋栗，荔枝和芒果是一些受欢迎风味的酸奶。

sentences.english: Mercerization of cotton fabrics is still very popular.
sentences.chinese: 棉织物的丝光整理依然很受欢迎。
那些建议是否不受欢迎？

sentences.english: Kite-flying is very popular in China.
sentences.chinese: 放风筝在中国很受欢迎。

sentences.english: Since that film scores a great success, its interlude songs are also much sought after.
sentences.chinese: 由于那部电影大获成功，它的插曲也很受欢迎。

sentences.english: Not to oppose India's U N seat bid by China a welcome development.
sentences.chinese: 中国不反对印度入常是一个受欢迎的举措。

sentences.english: This makes him the most popular Brazilian president since 1990.
sentences.chinese: 这让他成为了自1990年以来最受欢迎的巴西总统。

sentences.english: Photo Gallery: Sydney Bondi Beach Sunbathing is a popular way to relax in Sydney.
sentences.chinese: 悉尼的日光浴是一个受欢迎的途径有利于松弛。

sentences.english: Dameisha Beach is one of the most popular beaches in Shenzhen.
sentences.chinese: 大梅沙海滩是深圳最受欢迎的海滩之一。

sentences.english: Short hair is gaining in popularity although men are supporting a variety of hairstyles.
sentences.chinese: 尽管男人们是不同发式的拥趸，短发却越来越受欢迎。

sentences.english: He skillfully parried the question with a clever reply.
sentences.chinese: 他很巧妙地避开了那个不受欢迎的问题。

sentences.english: The Beatles created some of the best-loved songs of all time.
sentences.chinese: 披头四乐团创作出一些史上最受欢迎的歌曲。

sentences.english: and then they go on to, yeah, be sort of, yeah, really popular.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他们一直很受欢迎。

sentences.english: Belly-painting isgrowing more popular as a baby-shower activity, Thompson says.
sentences.chinese: 汤普森说，作为婴儿淋浴活动，肚皮画越来越受欢迎。

sentences.english: When worn, the utility model can eliminate odors, and thus is suitable for people who have osmidrosis.
sentences.chinese: 本上衣穿在身上能除异味，特别有腋臭的人更受欢迎。

sentences.english: He was declared persona non grata and thrown out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 他被这个国家宣布为不受欢迎的人并被驱逐出境。

definition: well-known for sth/to become well known/to make one's mark
to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
(a product) sells well/to be in demand
to treasure/to be very fond of
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
